intro: Hieracium brachycybe, commonly known as the short-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
